Name: rng_seed
Description: Random starting seed

Name: param_id
Description: Parameters identifier

Name: n_total
Description: Total population simulated

Name: mean_work_interactions_child
Description: Mean daily interactions at work (school) for children (aged 0-19)

Name: mean_work_interactions_adult
Description: Mean daily interactions at work for adults (aged 20-69)

Name: mean_work_interactions_elderly
Description: Mean daily interactions at work (or similar) for the elderly (aged 70+)

Name: daily_fraction_work
Description: Fraction of people in work network that an individual interacts with each day

Name: work_network_rewire
Description: Rewire parameter on the Watts-Strogatz work networks

Name: mean_random_interactions_child
Description: Mean number of daily random interactions for children (0-19)

Name: sd_random_interactions_child
Description: Standard deviation for daily random interactions for children (0-19)

Name: mean_random_interactions_adult
Description: Mean number of daily random interactions for adults (20-69)

Name: sd_random_interactions_adult
Description: Standard deviation for daily random interactions for adults (20-69)

Name: mean_random_interactions_elderly
Description: Mean number of daily random interactions for the elderly (70+)

Name: sd_random_interactions_elderly
Description: Standard deviation for daily random interactions for the elderly (70+)

Name: random_interaction_distribution
Description: Distribution used for random interactions (0=fixed, age dep, 1=negative binomial)

Name: child_network_adults
Description: Ratio of adults to children in work network for children (0-19)

Name: elderly_network_adults
Description: Ratio of adults to elderly in work network for elderly (70+)

Name: days_of_interactions
Description: Length of historic interactions traced (days)

Name: end_time
Description: End time (total number of simulated days)

Name: n_seed_infection
Description: Number of infections seeded at simulation start

Name: mean_infectious_period
Description: Mean of the generation time distribution (days)
Source: Ferretti et al in prep 2020; Ferretti & Wymant et al 2020; Xia et al 2020; He et al 2020; Cheng et al 2020

Name: sd_infectious_period
Description: Standard deviation (days) of infectious period
Source: Ferretti et al in prep 2020; Ferretti & Wymant et al 2020; Xia et al 2020; He et al 2020; Cheng et al 2020

Name: infectious_rate
Description: Mean number of individuals infected by each infectious individual with moderate to severe symptoms

Name: sd_infectiousness_multiplier
Description: SD of the lognormal used to vary the infectiousness of an individual

Name: mean_time_to_symptoms
Description: Mean time from infection to onset of symptoms (days)

Name: sd_time_to_symptoms
Description: Standard deviation of time from infection to onset of symptoms (days)

Name: mean_time_to_hospital
Description: Mean time from symptom onset to hospitalisation (days)

Name: mean_time_to_critical
Description: Mean time from hospitalisation to critical care admission (days)
Source: Personal communication with SPI-M; data soon to be published

Name: sd_time_to_critical
Description: Standard deviation of time from hospitalisation to critical care admission (days)
Source: Personal communication with SPI-M; data soon to be published

Name: mean_time_to_recover
Description: Mean time to recovery if hospitalisation is not required (days)

Name: sd_time_to_recover
Description: Standard deviation of time to recovery if hospitalisaion is not required (days)

Name: mean_time_to_death
Description: Mean time to death after acquiring critical care (days)
Source: Personal communication with SPI-M; data soon to be published

Name: sd_time_to_death
Description: Standard deviation of time to death after acquiring critical care (days)
Source: Personal communication with SPI-M; data soon to be published

Name: mean_time_to_susceptible_after_shift
Description: mean time to susceptible after recovered (and after a fixed period of `time_to_susceptible_shift` days)

Name: time_to_susceptible_shift
Description: Fixed number of days individuals are immune until waning immunity begins

Name: fraction_asymptomatic_0_9
Description: Fraction of infected individuals who are asymptomatic, aged 0-9

Name: fraction_asymptomatic_10_19
Description: Fraction of infected individuals who are asymptomatic, aged 10-19
Source: Calibration of Riccardo et al. 2020 & Spanish Serology Survey

Name: fraction_asymptomatic_20_29
Description: Fraction of infected individuals who are asymptomatic, aged 20-29
Source: Calibration of Riccardo et al. 2020 & Spanish Serology Survey

Name: fraction_asymptomatic_70_79
Description: Fraction of infected individuals who are asymptomatic, aged 70-79

Name: fraction_asymptomatic_80
Description: Fraction of infected individuals who are asymptomatic, aged 80+

Name: asymptomatic_infectious_factor
Description: Infectious rate of asymptomatic individuals relative to symptomatic individuals

Source: Personal communication with SPI-M; data soon to be published

Source: Personal communication with SPI-M; data soon to be published

Name: location_death_icu_0_9
Description: Proportion of individuals in 0-9 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_10_19
Description: Proportion of individuals in 10-19 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_20_29
Description: Proportion of individuals in 20-29 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_30_39
Description: Proportion of individuals in 30-39 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_40_49
Description: Proportion of individuals in 40-49 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_50_59
Description: Proportion of individuals in 50-59 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_60_69
Description: Proportion of individuals in 60-69 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_70_79
Description: Proportion of individuals in 70-79 year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: location_death_icu_80
Description: Proportion of individuals in 80+ year olds with critical symptoms that reach critical care (the remaining proportion die outside of critical care; note that the remaining proportion are marked as being hospitalised in the transmission and timeseries files)

Name: quarantine_length_self
Description: Maximum number of days quarantine for individuals self-reporting symptoms

Name: quarantine_length_traced_symptoms
Description: Maximum number of days quarantine for individuals who are traced after a contact reported symptoms

Name: quarantine_length_traced_positive
Description: Maximum number of days quarantine for individuals who are traced after a contact tested positive

Name: quarantine_length_positive
Description: Maximum number of days quarantine for individuals with a positive test result

Name: quarantine_dropout_self
Description: Daily probability of drop out for an individual quarantining after self-reporting symptoms

Name: quarantine_dropout_traced_symptoms
Description: Daily probability of drop out for an individual quarantining after being traced following contact with an individual self-reporting symptoms

Name: quarantine_dropout_traced_positive
Description: Daily probability of drop out for an individual quarantining after being traced following contact with an individual who tested positive

Name: quarantine_dropout_positive
Description: Daily probability of drop out for an individual quarantining after a positive test result

Name: quarantine_compliance_traced_symptoms
Description: Fraction of individuals who initially comply with a quarantine notification after their contact reported symptoms

Name: quarantine_compliance_traced_positive
Description: Fraction of individuals who initially comply with a quarantine notification after their contact tested positive

Name: test_on_symptoms
Description: Test individuals who show symptoms (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: test_on_traced
Description: Test individuals who have been contact-traced (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: test_release_on_negative
Description: Release individuals following a negative test (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: trace_on_symptoms
Description: Trace contacts of individuals who show symptoms (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: trace_on_positive
Description: Trace contacts of an individual who tests positive (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: retrace_on_positive
Description: Repeat contract tracing be carried out on a positive test if already traced on symptoms (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: quarantine_on_traced
Description: Quarantine individuals who are traced (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: traceable_interaction_fraction
Description: Fraction of interactions that are captured if both users have the app

Name: tracing_network_depth
Description: Depth of interaction network to contact

Name: allow_clinical_diagnosis
Description: Commence contact tracing on a hospital clinical diagnosis

Name: quarantine_household_on_positive
Description: Quarantine household members of a person with a positive test (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: quarantine_household_on_symptoms
Description: Quarantine household members of a person with symptoms (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: quarantine_household_on_traced_positive
Description: Quarantine household members of a person who has been traced following contact with an individual who has tested positive (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: quarantine_household_on_traced_symptoms
Description: Quarantine household members of a person who has been traced following contact with an individual who has self-reported symptoms (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: quarantine_household_contacts_on_positive
Description: Quarantine the contacts of each household member of a person who tests positive (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: quarantine_household_contacts_on_symptoms
Description: Quarantine the contacts of other household members when someone gets symptoms

Name: quarantined_daily_interactions
Description: Daily random interactions of a quarantined individual

Name: quarantine_days
Description: The number of previous days' contacts to be traced and contacted

Name: quarantine_smart_release_day
Description: Release a chain of quarantined people if after this number of days nobody has shown symptoms on the chain

Name: hospitalised_daily_interactions
Description: Daily random interactions of a hospitalised individual

Name: test_insensitive_period
Description: Number of days following infection the test is insensitive

Name: test_sensitive_period
Description: Number of days following infection to end of period where test is sensitive

Name: test_sensitivity
Description: Sensitivity of test in the time where it is sensitive

Name: test_specificity
Description: Specificity of test (at any time)

Name: test_order_wait
Description: Minimum number of days to wait to take a test

Name: test_order_wait_priority
Description: Minimum number of days to wait for a priority test to be taken

Name: test_result_wait
Description: Number of days to wait for a test result

Name: test_result_wait_priority
Description: Number of days to wait for a priority test result

Name: priority_test_contacts_0_9
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 0-9 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_10_19
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 10-19 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_20_29
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 20-29 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_30_39
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 30-39 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_40_49
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 40-49 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_50_59
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 50-59 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_60_69
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 60-69 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_70_79
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 70-79 years old

Name: priority_test_contacts_80
Description: Number of contacts that triggers priority test for individuals aged 80+ years old

Name: self_quarantine_fraction
Description: Proportion of people who self-quarantine upon symptoms

Name: app_users_fraction_0_9
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 0-9

Name: app_users_fraction_10_19
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 10-19

Name: app_users_fraction_20_29
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 20-29

Name: app_users_fraction_30_39
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 30-39

Name: app_users_fraction_40_49
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 40-49

Name: app_users_fraction_50_59
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 50-59

Name: app_users_fraction_60_69
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 60-69

Name: app_users_fraction_70_79
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 70-79

Name: app_users_fraction_80
Description: Maximum fraction of the population with smartphones aged 80+

Name: app_turn_on_time
Description: Time (days) at which to turn on the app

Name: lockdown_occupation_multiplier_primary_network
Description: Relative change in number of occupation network contacts on lockdown for primary age

Name: lockdown_occupation_multiplier_secondary_network
Description: Relative change in number of occupation network contacts on lockdown for secondary age

Name: lockdown_occupation_multiplier_working_network
Description: Relative change in number of occupation network contacts on lockdown for working age
Source: Based on an estimate of the number of key workers

Name: lockdown_occupation_multiplier_retired_network
Description: Relative change in number of occupation network contacts on lockdown for retired age

Name: lockdown_occupation_multiplier_elderly_network
Description: Relative change in number of occupation network contacts on lockdown for elderly

Name: lockdown_random_network_multiplier
Description: Relative change in random network contacts on lockdown

Name: lockdown_house_interaction_multiplier
Description: Relative change in household network contacts on lockdown

Name: lockdown_time_on
Description: Time (days) at which to model lockdown starting

Name: lockdown_time_off
Description: Time (days) at which to model lockdown ending

Name: lockdown_elderly_time_on
Description: Time (days) at which lockdown starts for elderly people

Name: lockdown_elderly_time_off
Description: Time (days) at which lockdown ends for elderly people

Name: testing_symptoms_time_on
Description: Time (days) at which to start testing on symptoms

Name: testing_symptoms_time_off
Description: Time (days) at which to stop testing on symptoms

Name: intervention_start_time
Description: Time (days) after which interventions can be turned on

Name: hospital_on
Description: Turn on the hospital module  (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: manual_trace_on
Description: Turn on manual tracing (0=no, 1=yes)

Name: manual_trace_time_on
Description: Time (days) after which manual tracing is turned on

Name: manual_trace_on_hospitalization
Description: Trace when hospitalized if tested positive (no effect if manual_trace_on_positive is on)

Name: manual_trace_on_positive
Description: Trace when hospitalized if tested positive (no effect if manual_trace_on_positive is on)

Name: manual_trace_delay
Description: Delay (days) between triggering manual tracing due to testing/hospitalization and tracing occurring

Name: manual_trace_exclude_app_users
Description: Whether or not to exclude app users when performing manual tracing (exclude=1, include=0)

Name: manual_trace_n_workers
Description: Number of Contact Tracing Workers

Name: manual_trace_interviews_per_worker_day
Description: Number of interviews performed per worker per day

Name: manual_trace_notifications_per_worker_day
Description: Number of trace notifications performed per worker per day

Name: manual_traceable_fraction_household
Description: The fraction of household contacts that can be successfully traced

Name: manual_traceable_fraction_occupation
Description: The fraction of occupation contacts that can be successfully traced

Name: manual_traceable_fraction_random
Description: The fraction of random contacts that can be successfully traced

Name: relative_susceptibility_by_interaction
Description: Type of relative susceptibility by age group (1 = per interaction; 0 = per day)

Name: rebuild_networks
Description: Should net works be rebuilt every time step or just on parameter changes
